titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Harry W. Trudell (1880-1964) was an amateur mineralogist and botanist. He was a member of the American Mineralogy Society, and the Business Manager of the American Mineralogist journal. Trudell took courses from Edgar T. Wherry at the Wagner Free Institute of Science, and also accompanied him on plant-collecting trips.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence with James G. Manchester, William Parish, Nicola D'Ascenzo, and Peter Zodac as well as pamphlets, newspaper clippings, advertisements, a typescript draft of Trudell's review of The minerals of New York City and its environs by J.G. Manchester for Rocks and Minerals (1931) as well as separates, reprints, and catalogues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: this collection contains reprints of some articles by Samuel George Gordon. Additional Gordon material is in the Samuel George Gordon papers (90-020, 92-013 and 92-014). Some correspondence with Trudell is in the Paul and Hilde Seel papers (90-025, 92-012, 92-016, and 92-019).
